sub_title: Program and Development Coordinator at John Adams Institute
summary: I am inquisitive, detail-oriented, and enjoy bringing people together to achieve a common goal.  I believe that to succeed in any field, precise and detailed communication is essential. I have worked in teaching, research and development, communications, and project management across a variety of industries: from education to marketing I describe I like to think of myself as an “all-rounder”. I am a go-to person for complex ideas and creative/innovative solutions. My passions represent a cross-cultural vector. My work emphasizes the importance of people, places, resistances, and of seeking out new ways to think things through. I can switch lenses and points of inquiry quickly and nimbly, and I love to be challenged by the work that I do.

education.field_of_study: BA Hons. Early Modern Studies & Classical History

awards.title: Amsterdam Merit Scholarship and Holland Scholar Programme
awards.description: The Amsterdam Merit Scholarships (AMS) have specifically been designed by the Universiteit van Amsterdam to offer talented and hard-working non-EU/EEA students the opportunity to pursue a degree in one of the academic fields covered by the UvA. The AMS programme is highly selective: only applicants with excellent study results and motivation may receive a scholarship. Scholarships are awarded to those who show particular promise in their chosen field.

awards.title: Thesis Award, University of King's College
awards.description: Awarded annually to the student in an honours programme who writes an outstanding thesis. My Thesis was entitled "The Struggle for Self Freedom: Situating Sturm und Drang Theatre in Romantic Opera".
awards.issuer: The University of King's College, Halifax

projects.title: Academic skills and academic integrity lecturer
projects.description: Through my position at the University of Amsterdam and personal experience as an international student in the Netherlands, I am able to approach the topic of study skills and student success in an nuanced way. Delivered primarily to international students, this lecture focuses not only on industry standards, but the importance of having our own (academic) ethical code and developing the craft of doing research.

contributors.headline: Program and Development Coordinator at John Adams Institute

projects.title: Workshop facilitator
projects.description: I have developed a workshop (series) on the importance of storytelling and how we describe ourselves to others. This has implications for a) how we see ourselves b) how we see ourselves in relations to others c) how we communicate, visualize, and achieve our goals. This interactive workshop enables participants to understand more about the craft and importance of personal storytelling, a useful technique that once learned can be effectively (re)employed.

contributors.headline: Program and Development Coordinator at John Adams Institute

profile_positions.description:
As Program and Development Coordinator I am responsible for organising the cultural programming and maintaining relationships in conjunction with the Director and Event Coordinator. 

The John Adams Institute provides an independent podium for American culture in the Netherlands. For over three decades, the JAI has brought the best and the brightest of American thinking from the fields of literature, politics, history and technology. Regardless of the stance taken, the United States plays an important role in the world: what happens in the US is of continuing relevance for the rest of the world, and we provide a window onto that. 

The John Adams Institute believes in the power of words and ideas, and in intellectual exchange through real-life encounters. Throughout the years, the JAI has invited speakers such as Madeleine Albright, Jonathan Safran Foer, Spike Lee, Jonathan Franzen and Nobel Prize winners Toni Morrison and Joseph Stiglitz – to name just a few – to share their thoughts and insights with audiences in the Netherlands. In addition to live events and streaming, we also produce a podcast (Bright Minds), offer a program for high schools, and host a book club.
profile_positions.title: Program and Development Coordinator

company.name: American Chamber of Commerce in the Netherlands (AmCham)

profile_positions.company: American Chamber of Commerce in the Netherlands (AmCham)
profile_positions.title: Member of Young Professionals Network

profile_positions.description: I work in the Department of Modern Foreign Languages and Cultures as a Lecturer, primarily on programmes for first-year Bachelor students. In my position at the UvA, I also actively research a variety of pressing topics related to climate change and humanity's relationship with the natural world.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

company.name: Graduate School of Social Sciences, University of Amsterdam

profile_positions.company: Graduate School of Social Sciences, University of Amsterdam
profile_positions.description:
The Summer Programmes Office offers a wide variety of interdisciplinary programmes in the social and behavioural sciences, and across other disciplines and fields. We use Amsterdam, a remarkable global city, as our classroom and living lab, drawing macro and micro connections on diverse subjects ranging from sustainability, to migration & integration, and sexuality studies. The University of Amsterdam is our home, and education is our raison d'être.

At the Summer Programmes Office, I was responsible for coordinating and developing a wide range of programmes, as well as maintaining our partner networks and contacts. I also had the chance to develop online courses, and hosted and edited our podcast, Mokum, where we interviewed experts in our communities on a variety of important topics.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator

profile_positions.description: As Summer Assistant at the Graduate School of Social Sciences in the Summer Programmes Office, it is my responsibility to help plan and craft a number of summer courses designed for international students. This also involves recruiting students that fit the participant profiles for each course and its unique specifications. The Summer Programmes Office welcomes hundreds of students from around the world each summer to study, live, and experience Amsterdam. Once students arrive, we act not only as academic and administrative coordinators, but also mentors and city ambassadors. Our courses include "Planning the Cycling City"​, "Migration and Integration: Refugees, Rights, and Realities"​, and "Amsterdam/Rotterdam: Exploring Identity"​.
profile_positions.title: Summer Assistant

profile_positions.description: My responsibilities include recruiting and welcoming students to the UvA community, both online and at university events. As an online and physical ambassador for the University of Amsterdam, I reply to a wide range of requests and queries, and help prospective students navigate not only the university and its programmes, but also, Amsterdam itself.
profile_positions.title: International Student Ambassador

profile_positions.description: At Amsterdam Worldwide I was responsible for a variety of tasks pertaining to research and exploratory strategic work. Over the course of my internship, I worked closely with management and other employees to deliver in-depth analyses of markets, cultural trends, and industry/company backgrounds, as a driven team with fascinating clients and questions.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description: As the high school liaison and outreach on campus, it was my duty to coordinate events as a "point of first contact" with the university. Further, I ran recruitment initiatives both on and off campus to promote the profile and message of the university. Job areas included office work and administration, running a comprehensive tour and event programme, as well as processing admissions documents.
profile_positions.title: On Campus Recruitment Coordinator and Admissions Officer

volunteer_experiences.description: The Buddy Netwerk and it’s team of dedicated administrators and volunteers supports people in a variety of ways to tackle loneliness, mobility issues, and various forms of rehabilitation. Their work is broad and varied: there are many meaningful ways to make a long term positive impact in people’s lives, and that’s what the Buddy Network is about.

#JustDiversity is a grassroots organisation for staff at the University of Amsterdam in support of immediate equity, diversity and inclusion. The organisation is non-hierarchical, and puts the emphasis primarily on providing a forum for discussion, sharing best practices and raising awareness around EDI. The focus in our meetings and events is on 'doing' diversity: since EDI projects often stall at the ideation stage, we wanted to create a community and venue for people to work out how to actually implement diversity at the UvA. #JustDiversity includes over 100 members across a number of faculties.
